result.execSummary:
The defendant Earl Dwane Tipton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from prison wages or within 90 days of release (12/21/16), or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be deducted from prison wages or within 90 days of release (12/21/16), or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after 6 months.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original PLEA AND SENTENCING Transcript (37 pages) commencing AUGUST 3, 2015(10:38 A.M.) received and filed. kl

Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for jury trial. 
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 3. Court orders COUNT 2 dismissed and read-in. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Statements made as to sentencing.  
As to COUNT 2: The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 54 MONTHS, with credit for 133 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 36 MONTHS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program" after 6 months.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs to be deducted from prison wages or within 90 days of release (12/21/16), or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. 
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges to be decucted from prison wages or within 90 days of release (12/21/16), or, if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Earl Dwane Tipton not in court, in custody.  
Hanna Kolberg for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Defense has been provided all discovery materials previously requested.   Defense still in contest posture; parties prepared to proceed to jury trial on the next date.  Case remains set for Jury Trial on 8-03-15 at 9:30 a.m. before Branch 35.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Earl Dwane Tipton not in court, in custody.  
Hannah Kolberg for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Appearance of the defendant waived for the purpose of todays proceedings.  Defense still in contest posture.  Defense awaiting additional discovery materials.  ADA Kolberg is covering this case; request for short adjournment granted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Bridget Joy Krause in court, defendant Earl Dwane Tipton not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-27-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial on 7.8.15 and jury trial on 8.3.15.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 07-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in custody.  Randy Sitzberger for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case #13CF5831 and bail/bond form in case #14CF3921 that are attached to the complaint.   Sworn for the state:Ronald Campos-MPD Officer.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in court with attorney Christian Thomas Eichenlaub on behalf of attorney Bridget Joy Krause. Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in custody.Ronald Dague on behalf of Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for Preliminary hearing. Defense counsel and defendant are requesting an adjournment. Defendant would like to proceed with attorney Krause. Defense would like to argue bail at next court date.  Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary Hearing  and bail/bond hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Earl Dwane Tipton in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
